ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Sex of subject at birth
Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than One Race; Unknown or Prefer Not to Answer;

ElementDescription: Ethnic group
ValueRange: Not Hispanic or Latino; Hispanic or Latino; Unknown or Prefer Not to Answer

ElementDescription: Phenotype/diagnosis for the subject
Description of the phenotype for the subject
Is this study of twins?
Was it sibling study?
Was it family study?
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: The number of session
The order of given run
Runtype, determined by type of STIMULUS delivered during stimulus phase
Onset time when CUE was displayed on screen
Onset time when EXPECTATION RATING SCALE was displayed on screen
Onset time when STIMULUS was delivered; Either on screen or via heat delivering device
Onset time when OUTCOME RATING SCALE was displayed on screen
Type of CUE displayed on screen
Type of STIMULUS intensity delivered to participant
Reaction Time of EXPECTATION RATING (time to press button from  onset02_ratingexpect)
Degree of EXPECTATION RATING, along a semicircle scale
Reaction Time of EXPECTATION RATING (time to press button from  onset04_ratingoutcome)
Degree of OUTCOME RATING, along a semicircle scale
